CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is the name of the electron donor material in the paragraph.
2. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM): This is the name of the electron acceptor material in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is the name of the electron donor material.
2. PC71BM: This is the name of the electron acceptor material.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is a specific type of electron donor material used in the polymer solar cells.
2. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM): This is a specific type of electron acceptor material used in the polymer solar cells.
3. power conversion efficiency: This is a property of the solar cells, representing the percentage of the incident light that is converted into electrical energy.
4. open circuit voltage: This is a property of the solar cells, representing the voltage at which the solar cells produce no current.
5. short circuit current: This is a property of the solar cells, representing the maximum current that the solar cells can produce under short circuit conditions.
6. mA cm^-2 : This is a unit of current density, which is a property of the solar cells.
7. fill factor: This is a property of the solar cells, representing the maximum achievable power output of the solar cells under standard test conditions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is a specific type of electron donor material used in the polymer solar cells.
2. PC71BM: This is a specific type of electron acceptor material used in the polymer solar cells.
3. power conversion efficiency: This is a property of the polymer solar cells.
4. open circuit voltage: This is a property of the polymer solar cells.
5. short circuit current: This is a property of the polymer solar cells.
6. fill factor: This is a property of the polymer solar cells.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| power conversion efficiency |
| open circuit voltage |
| short circuit current |
| fill factor |
| PBDT-TDPP-S (electron donor material) |
| PC71BM (electron acceptor material) |
